data.title: VSCode is very slow on my system
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.2
- OS Version: Windows 8.1 Enterprise 64-bit

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Please try to run vsCode faster than now.
2. Enable drag selected text to move it (See this: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/33858029)

data.title: Debug Listener Crashes when TCP Connection is Closed
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.2
- OS Version: Windows 8.1

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  Launch a Visual Studio Code Node Project. 
2.  Close the TCP connection of the debug listener (currPorts freeware utility is helpful for this http://www.nirsoft.net/utils/cports.html).

The following error was encountered sporadically (approximately once a week) when debugging in Visual Studio Code:

events.js:154
      throw er; // Unhandled 'error' event
      ^

Error: read ECONNRESET
    at exports._errnoException (util.js:890:11)
    at TCP.onread (net.js:552:26)

I was able to reproduce this error by closing the TCP connection of the debug listener when debugging in Visual Studio Code.

I believe it should be possible to handle and recover from this error, because the node express application I am debugging is able to reconnect when I close its TCP connection.

data.title: [loc][Query][VSCode] Please clarify the string
data.body:
Hi, we have a question from our translator. Can you help please? Thanks!

Source:
Controls if opened editors from Quick Open show as preview. Preview editors are reused until they are kept (e.g. via double click or editing).

File Name:
src\vs\workbench\electron-browser\main.contribution.nls.resx

Resource ID:
".resx", 0; "enablePreviewFromQuickOpen"

Query:
Is "Quick Open" localizable? Thanks.    Zinacle 9/13/2016 5:11:39 PM

data.title: [loc][Query][VSCode] Please clarify string
data.body:
Hi, we have a question from our translator. Can you help please? Thanks!

Source:
A set of command IDs whose keybindings will not be sent to the shell and instead always be handled by Code. This allows the use of keybindings that would normally be consumed by the shell to act the same as when the terminal is not focused, for example ctrl+p to launch Quick Open.

File Name:
src\vs\workbench\parts\terminal\electron-browser\terminal.contribution.nls.resx

Resource ID:
".resx", 0; "terminal.integrated.commandsToSkipShell"

Query:
Is "Code" here a general term or does it refer to the editor? Is "Open Quick" localizable? Thanks.  Zinacle 9/13/2016 5:05:37 PM

data.title: Comment shortcut (Cmd + /) stopped working in HTML
data.body:
- VSCode Version: latest Insiders: 1.6.0-insider
- OS Version: osx

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open HTML file
2. Select a few lines
3. Hit Cmd + /
4. Nothing

The shortcut still works in TS/JS when selecting single or multiple lines.

data.title: Fill out a Voluntary Product Accessibility Template (VPAT)
data.body:
Please consider filling out a VPAT for VS Code. This is a form that outlines the accessibility features and Section 508 compliance of a product. VS Code would be more readily adopted throughout the federal government if it has a VPAT available.

Current list of Microsoft VPATs, could serve as examples: https://enterprise.microsoft.com/en-us/industries/government/section-508-vpats-for-microsoft-products/

data.body: Provide GUI for settings.

data.title: Debugging no longer working since Sept 14th update
data.body:
- VSCode Version:
  ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1096293/18552448/6096090c-7b54-11e6-8308-7b4cb69ee677.png)
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

Debugging our typescript application using the app.ts file in the route was working right up to yesterday. It now does not start the app. 

It appears to be related to the source maps setting = true in the launch.json as setting this to false and running against the app.js works.

This is critical to ours and I imagine many other peoples debug process.

data.title: Tasks: Support that a problem matcher can define the 'source'

milestone.title: On Deck
milestone.description:
The Issues assigned to the **On Deck** milestone under consideration for the upcoming milestones.
Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

data.body: To support that a task can produce errors that have a `source` attribute. The Problem matcher should support a `source` attribute.

data.title: Errors from run npm script are not showed in 'Problems' pane
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.2
- OS Version: Windows 10, 64bit

Steps to Reproduce:
1. File `package.json` with scripts section like this `"start": "webpack --config webpack.config.production.js"`
2. File `tasks.json`, command set to `npm` and task set to "start" (to run npm start)

After executing such task, npm runs webpack which in turns builds typescript via loader (ts-loader). Output from webpack build is written to `OUTPUT` pane (which is ok). When typescript compile fails it is written to OUTPUT pane but it is not detected in 'Problems` pane (main menu View -> Problems).

Is this possible to support such error OUTPUT to be parse to Problems pane automatically by vscode?

data.title: Save all keyboard short cut feature
data.body:
With Javascript compile watchers, saving all files at once is crucial for avoiding unnecessary build failures.

On Mac OS there is no keyboard shortcut to "Save All" files.

data.title: Consider surfacing mapped variable names
data.body:
Sourcemaps can represent variable name mappings, like when they're changed in minified code, or TypeScript's `this => _this`. Chrome DevTools shows the original variable names in their variables sidebar: https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=327092

One problem is that if you don't know the original names, you can't inspect them in the console or with watches. But I think it would still make debugging easier to have them just in the variables pane.

We could go one step further by showing both names, in the variable name space, just like `myArray (t)`. And another step by adding this to the protocol so that the context menu "Add to Watch" would work. I don't know if it's a useful concept outside of JS though.

data.title: Task framework should show status icon about watching tasks
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.0

We do have a status icon however this is only visible if the task is actively running. We should show the task in watch mode as well and allow certain actions (like terminate) on the status bar icon.

data.title: formatOnType does not work when you navigate away from the edited line
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.2 
- OS Version: OSX 10.11.6

I have `"editor.formatOnType": true` in my settings.json. It works fine when I press enter or closing bracket, but when I navigate away from the edited line (e.g. press UP/DOWN arrow, mouse-click, ...) it does not format the edited line. 

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Type `let a = 1;`
2. Press enter
3. Navigate back to the line and add some whitespace before the number 1
4. Press DOWN arrow
5. Notice that the line stays incorrectly formated

data.title: Right clicking Recycle Bin on Windows has the option to "Open with Code - Insiders"
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Insider build (1.6.0-insider, commit fad6a894c197ee791403ac694c9316b0654f31a4)
- OS Version: Windows 10.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Right click on the Recycle Bin icon on the desktop.
2. Notice there's a "Open with Code - Insiders" option.
   ![](https://i.imgur.com/g7L8Cug.png)
3. When clicked, nothing happens.

Potentially unwanted functionality and possibly added by https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/commit/cc728e7bc6a60d7e6c00e254c3c2773fa68802b4.

data.title: vscode 1.6 broke Git changes in gutter
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6insider
- OS Version: Win10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Make changes to some version-controlled file 
2. Notice the absence of markings in the gutter which showed which lines have changed.
3. Despair, come to senses, wait while this issue is resolved & install vscode stable in the meanwhile.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.2
- OS Version: Win10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. create a compile time error in some file
2. watch the file list

It would be cool if the file list on the left would show errors inside ts or cs files. Very helpful when refactoring or updating libraries with breaking changes.

data.title: UI state lost when VS Code is terminated ungracefully

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.2
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Let VS Code open, lock the computer
2. Let Windows install updates and automatically restart the computer

After logging into Windows and launching VS Code, VS Code opens the project that was opened last time, but it doesn't restore editors to the state they were in last time. It restores some much older state instead (probably from last time the "Close folder" menu option was used). Very annoying.
